Articles.Content:
This should be interesting.

For me, it's Firefox.

I use a Browser called Lunascape. It is a Tri-Engine Browser, It can seemlessly switch between the Trident engine(Internet Explorer), the Gecko engine (Firefox), and the Webkit engine (Chrome/Safari) for rendering a page. Barely uses and CPU to run. Argueably more secure than Chrome, Fully customizable.
I use chrome for Adblock.

I use chrome partially out of habit and partially because it is a browser that is unified across all my devices, so it is handy when I am out I can have the same tabs on my phone as on my computer if I am doing fixture research or looking for help on an issue. also auctions because why not buy stuff. I am not against other browsers IE is now actually a rather good browser and does not deserve the stigma it gained so yea. That is all.

I use a Browser called Lunascape. It is a Tri-Engine Browser, It can seemlessly switch between the Trident engine(Internet Explorer), the Gecko engine (Firefox), and the Webkit engine (Chrome/Safari) for rendering a page. Barely uses and CPU to run. Argueably more secure than Chrome, Fully customizable.

excellent choice.

While I prefer palemoon(a windows optimised firefox with some features trimmed to speed it up), there is the odd page that refuses to load properly if your not using IE, and for that, I use lunascape, every bit as capable of dealing with IE eccentricities, yet nowhere near as much of a vulnerability.

I use a Browser called Lunascape.

I might try that out. I do have a penchant for exotic browsers.
I think Safari should be in list but Firefox forever
I use FireFox out of inertia. I just haven't moved to a new browser despite the fact that I'm not real happy with it anymore. It just isn't as good as it used to be.

I used to be a Firefox evangelist, but it started getting bloated and very slow. Switched to Chrome and haven't looked back. I also like how it integrates with Google products as well.

Cheers!

Capt'n Skunky

KSP Community Manager

I might try that out. I do have a penchant for exotic browsers.
excellent choice.

While I prefer palemoon(a windows optimised firefox with some features trimmed to speed it up), there is the odd page that refuses to load properly if your not using IE, and for that, I use lunascape, every bit as capable of dealing with IE eccentricities, yet nowhere near as much of a vulnerability.

I was a long time user of Internet Explorer(Probably the only Universal 64-bit Browser, Don't believe me?, Google it.) Lunascape is a very good step in the right direction for browsers.
Firefox is my overlord.
ONE WORD: Safari.

Safari. But only on a Mac (the trackpad gestures are Heaven on earth).

For anything else, like Windows, Chrome.

And to whoever said they use Chrome for AdBlock, AdBlock is available on Firefox, Safari, and Internet Explorer as well, probably even more.
I guess this says it all:

Hmmmm...

I like IE, its good for a basic browser.

But for quickly doing gmail, and remembering accounts like on KSP forum (IE never wants to remember), Chrome.

Plus I need it for Fairing Factory.

May I?

Edited May 3, 2013 by The Destroyer

Palemoon.

Firefox -90% of the useless code.
Chrome, love at first sight!
Call me backwards if you like, but I still use Internet Explorer. Kind of like one of those "I only like vanilla ice-cream" KSPers.

Google Chrome. Fast and simple. Rarely makes my PC freeze.

IE is my favorite browser... for downloading other browsers.
Opera...which I seem to be only of 2.

May I?

I remember that photo. Reminds me why I use both Firefox and Chrome.

But if you want favorite browsers, I made my own. Screw competition.
I am your standard Chrome user.
